abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the resettlement policy
            framework is to identify the principles and procedures to be
            followed in order to compensate people who may be negatively
            affected by the project so as to ensure they will be
            assisted to improve, or at least restore their living
            standards, income, and/or production capacity levels to
            pre-project levels. The general principles for the framework
            include : minimizing resettlement and land acquisition where
            possible; compensating, relocating, and rehabilitating
            project affected persons (PAPs); compensating all PAPs for
            their losses and/or income rehabilitation without regard to
            their legal rights; setting compensation at full replacement
            cost for houses and other structures, agricultural land of
            equal productive capacity, replacement of residential land
            at least of equal size, full compensation for crops, trees,
            and other similar agricultural products at market value;
            providing transportation assistance and home
            reestablishment, a dislocation allowance, along with
            providing residential land and replacement cost of homes;
            replacing land-for-land as the preferred option, or
            substituting cash ; minimizing the resettlement transition
            period; maintaining or improving the previous level of
            community services and access to resources; and arranging
            effective and timely internal and external monitoring of the
            implementation of resettlement measures.
